rue Jarry Est / [[Berri Streeat|rue Berri]]
rue Jarry Est / rue Lajeunesse [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Jarry.pdf Jarry Station Neighbourhood Map] |}} '''Jarry''' is a [[metro station|station]] on the [[Line 2 Orange (Montreal Metro)|Orange Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]], operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is located in the borough of [[VillerayâSaint-MichelâParc-Extension]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]] [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m04.htm Jarry Metro Station]. The station opened on October 14, 1966, as part of the original network of the metro. == Overview == The metro station, designed by Lemoyne, Bland, Edwards, & Shine, is a normal [[side platform]] station, built in [[tunnel]]. The [[Mezzanine (architecture)|mezzanine]] near the north end is connected to an entrance integrated into the ground floor of an apartment building. The station is known for the diamond-shaped [[Deep foundation|caissons]] in the ceiling of the [[Transept#Other senses of the word|transept]]. ==Origin of the name== This station is named for [[Jarry Street|rue Jarry]], which in turn commemorates Bernard Bleignier dit Jarry, who received a concession in 1700 that later became the village of Saint-Laurent. The street was built on land belonging to Stanislas Jarry pÃ¨re, a descendant of Bernard Jarry, who was mayor of the village in 1907. ==Connecting bus routes== [[File:Montreal metro Jarry.jpg|300px|right|thumb|Inside Jarry station]] {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
